rules.natural: Either the EU region requires approval for the investment fund or the US region requires approval for the investment fund.
Whenever the investment fund qualifies for automatic approval, it is approved for sale.

Assuming the investment fund meets solvency requirements, should the absence of the EU approval implying global marketability not result in Asia not requiring approval, then the fund qualifies for automatic approval.
Given that the investment fund is compliant with Basel III, if it has insurance coverage then it meets solvency requirements.
If the investment fund is registered with the SEC, it is compliant with Basel III.
Provided that the investment fund is registered with ESMA, it is compliant with Basel III.
When the investment fund is subject to frequent reporting, it is registered with the SEC or with ESMA.
Either the investment fund is subject to frequent reporting or it is subject to annual reporting.
Under the condition that the investment fund is subject to annual reporting, it is registered with the SEC or with ESMA.
If the investment fund is under investigation, then it is flagged for review.
Whenever the US region requires approval for the investment fund, the fund is globally marketable.
In the case that the investment fund is facing regulatory action, it is under investigation.
Provided that the investment fund has a strong credit rating, if the failure of meeting capital requirements to lead to approval for sale occurs, then the fund is facing regulatory action.
The investment fund has a strong credit rating or it has a weak credit rating.

The investment fund is subject to sanctions, or it is involved in fraud, or if compliant with KYC rules, it violates anti-money laundering or, given a weak credit rating, the failure of capital requirements to ensure approval leads to regulatory action.
Whenever the investment fund passes the stress test, it maintains the liquidity ratio.
Provided that the investment fund is authorized for cross-border sales, it is globally marketable.
In the event that the investment fund is a high net worth product, if the EU region requires approval, then it is authorized for cross-border sales.
Assuming the investment fund is a retail investor product, should the EU region require approval, then it is authorized for cross-border sales.
If the investment fund is a complex financial instrument, then it is a high net worth product.
Either the investment fund is a complex financial instrument or it is a simple financial instrument.
Provided that the investment fund is derivatives-based, if it is a simple financial instrument, then it is a retail investor product.
In the case that the investment fund is equity-based, whenever it is a simple financial instrument, it is a retail investor product.
The investment fund is blacklisted by regulators, or it is derivatives-based, or it is equity-based.
The investment fund is recommended by advisors or it is cautioned by advisors.
Under the condition that the investment fund is cautioned by advisors, it is not blacklisted by regulators.
Given that the investment fund is endorsed by a regulatory body, if it is recommended by advisors, then it is not blacklisted by regulators.
If the investment fund has risk disclosure, then it is approved for sale.
In the event that the EU banking authority conducts a regulator audit of the investment fund, if it meets capital requirements then it has risk disclosure.
Either the EU banking authority conducts a regulator audit of the investment fund or the US banking authority conducts a regulator audit of the investment fund.
If the US banking authority conducts a regulator audit of the investment fund, then the Asia banking authority conducts a regulator audit of the investment fund.
Provided that the Asia banking authority conducts a regulator audit of the investment fund, if it meets capital requirements then it has risk disclosure.
Should it not be the case that if the EU region requires approval then the fund is globally marketable, then the Asia region requires approval.
Whenever it is false that maintaining the liquidity ratio leads to approval for sale, the investment fund requires a bailout.
Under the condition that maintaining the liquidity ratio does not imply approval for sale, the investment fund does not require a bailout.
Whenever the scenario where the absence of EU approval leading to global marketability does not cause Asia to not require approval is true, the investment fund passes the stress test.
Provided that the situation where the negation of the EU approval implying global marketability does not lead to Asia not requiring approval holds, the investment fund meets capital requirements.

The investment fund is compliant with KYC rules.
The investment fund is endorsed by a regulatory body.
It is not the case that the investment fund is flagged for review.
The investment fund does not violate anti-money laundering rules.
The investment fund is not involved in fraud.
The investment fund is not subject to sanctions.
The investment fund is not approved for sale.
